title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente.
While the pasta is cooking, fry the pancetta in a pan over medium heat until crisp. Remove from heat.
In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs, cheeses, and a generous amount of black pepper.
Drain the pasta, reserving a cup of the pasta water. Quickly add the hot pasta to the pan with the pancetta and toss.
Remove the pan from the heat and pour in the egg and cheese mixture, stirring quickly to create a creamy sauce. Add a splash of pasta water if it's too thick.
Serve immediately with an extra sprinkle of cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate the chicken in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, and chili powder for at least 1 hour.
Grill or pan-fry the chicken until cooked through. Set aside.
In a large pan, heat oil and saut√© the onions until golden brown.
Add the tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the masala.
Stir in the heavy cream and garam masala. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the cooked chicken to the gravy and cook for another 5-10 minutes.
Serve hot with naan or rice.
